text:
Hello Sandipan, Good Evening
First of all Sorry for Late reply.

Just Follow the guidelines as stated in this  link:
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/snippets/responsive/how-to-implement-a-fixed-top-mobile-navigation-design-manager>
resource & while selecting menu from default modules Select "Menu" not "Simple Menu.
For clarification I will attach two photos of menu.
Select the latter one from menu.
You can see the hamburger-menu effect  here : <https://app.HubSpot.com/design-previewer/4757321/templates/13364569549>
Hey Folks, I have a question regarding creating a module for MarketPlace. Do I need to learn Jinja Language for creating template/Modules ?

And one thing more,
Apart from HubSpot Coomunity and Slack Community is there any resource  in the form of Video/E-book/Code Gallery to  grasp  better knowledge for Creating Module.
The main Problem which I am facing is that I am able to Create  things in external text editor
like Atom,VS Code, but while creating it for marketplace I am facing Problem.
BTW, I would be grateful for any help you are able to provide.
Hi, so the language you'll want to learn is HubL which is based on jinja. <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/syntax>
Here is a basic intro to building custom modules. <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/modules/getting-started>

I would also encourage taking the cms for developers course there is a link in the discovery kit, which would also be very helpful to you.
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/discoverykit>
I hope this will help you.
Thanks a ton for all the info!

Hello! I have created a custom module that lets you add a Timeline of maintenance activities for our clients. The timeline will consist of stories to be created on different dates of the month. Each stories has a title, category and description. Now, we want to have a filter of category and date ranges. Can you guys help me how to achieve this? Thanks!
